name: add_item_to_bill
description:
This tool will create an invoice item in Stripe.

This function creates an invoice item in Stripe. It uses the provided customer ID,
price ID, and invoice ID to define the new invoice item's associations and
link it to the respective customer, product/service price, and invoice.

target_customer_id.description: The ID of the customer to create the invoice item for.

product_price_id.description: The ID of the price for the item.

destination_invoice_id.description: The ID of the invoice to create the item for.

name: add_new_catalog_item
description:
This tool will create a product in Stripe.

This function creates a product in Stripe. It accepts a name for the product,
which is mandatory, and an optional description to further detail the product.

name: assign_item_price
description:
This tool will create a price in Stripe.

This function creates a new price. If a product has not already been
specified, a product should be created first. It uses the provided product ID,
unit amount (in cents), and currency to define the new price.

associated_product_id.description: The ID of the product to create the price for.

amount_in_cents.description: The unit amount of the price in cents. Non negative integer. Defaults to None.

name: complete_and_send_bill
description:
This tool will finalize an invoice in Stripe.

This function finalizes an invoice in Stripe. It takes the ID of the invoice to finalize as an argument.

invoice_id_to_finalize.description: The ID of the invoice to finalize.

name: fetch_all_catalog_items
description:
This tool will fetch a list of Products from Stripe.

This tool fetches a list of Products from Stripe. It takes one optional argument, `limit`, to specify the number of products to return.

page_size.description: A limit on the number of objects to be returned. Limit can range between 1 and 100, and the default is 10.

name: fetch_available_discounts
description:
This tool will fetch a list of Coupons from Stripe.

This function fetches a list of Coupons from Stripe. It takes one optional argument,
`limit`, which is an integer used to specify the number of coupons to return.

coupon_list_limit.description: A limit on the number of objects to be returned. Limit can range between 1 and 100.

name: find_all_transactions
description:
This tool will list payment intents in Stripe.

This function lists payment intents in Stripe. It takes an optional customer ID
to list payment intents for a specific customer, and an optional limit to specify
the number of payment intents to return.

search_by_customer_id.description: The ID of the customer to list payment intents for.

result_count_limit.description: A limit on the number of objects to be returned. Limit can range between 1 and 100.

name: generate_new_discount_code
description:
This function creates a coupon in Stripe. The discount can be specified either as a percentage off via `percent_off`

or as a fixed amount off via `amount_off`. It is essential that only one of these, `percent_off` or `amount_off`,
is used to define the discount; providing values for both, or values for neither
that define a valid discount, will result in an error. If `amount_off` is used as the discount method,
the `currency` parameter must also be appropriately set (it defaults to 'USD').
The function also supports optional parameters to define the coupon's duration. The `duration`
parameter specifies how long the discount remains active and accepts 'once', 'repeating', or 'forever'
(defaulting to 'once'). If `duration` is 'repeating', the `duration_in_months` parameter is
required to indicate the number of months the coupon applies.

discount_code_name.description: Name of the coupon displayed to customers on invoices or receipts.

fixed_amount_discount.description:
A positive integer representing the amount to subtract from an
invoice total. This parameter is required by the function signature.

discount_currency.description:
Three-letter ISO code for the currency of the `amount_off`
parameter (e.g., 'USD', 'EUR'). This is required if `amount_off` is used to
specify the discount and `percent_off` is not provided. Defaults to 'USD'.

discount_duration_type.description:
Specifies how long the discount will last. Valid values
are 'once', 'repeating', or 'forever'. Defaults to 'once'.

percentage_discount_value.description:
A positive float greater than or equal to 0 and less than or
equal to 100, representing the percentage discount the coupon will apply.
If provided, this defines the coupon's discount instead of `amount_off`.

repeating_duration_in_months.description:
If `duration` is 'repeating', this specifies
the number of months the discount will apply.

name: generate_purchase_url
description:
Creates a payment link in Stripe.

This function creates a payment link in Stripe. It takes the ID of the price
to create the payment link for and the quantity of the product to include
in the payment link.

price_identifier.description: The ID of the price to create the payment link for.

number_of_items.description: The quantity of the product to include.

name: get_account_balance
description:
Retrieves the balance from Stripe.

This function retrieves the balance from Stripe. It takes no input.

name: get_all_payment_disputes
description:
This function fetches a list of disputes in Stripe. It allows filtering the

disputes based on an associated charge ID or PaymentIntent ID, and limiting
the number of results.

filter_by_transaction_id.description:
Only return disputes associated to the charge
specified by this charge ID.

filter_by_payment_intent_id.description:
Only return disputes associated to the
PaymentIntent specified by this PaymentIntent ID. Defaults to None.

max_disputes_to_return.description:
A limit on the number of objects to be returned. Limit can
range between 1 and 100, and the default is 10.

name: get_all_pricing_schemes
description:
This tool will fetch a list of Prices from Stripe.

This function fetches a list of Prices from Stripe. It takes two optional arguments:
`product`, the ID of the product to list prices for, and `limit`, the number of prices to return.

filter_by_item_id.description: The ID of the product to list prices for. Defaults to None.

maximum_prices_to_fetch.description: A limit on the number of objects to be returned. Limit can range between 1 and 100. Defaults to 10.

name: issue_new_bill
description:
This tool will create an invoice in Stripe.

This tool creates an invoice in Stripe. It takes the ID of the customer (`customer`) for whom to create the invoice, and an optional number of days (`days_until_due`) until the invoice is due.

billed_customer_id.description: The ID of the customer to create the invoice for.

payment_due_period_days.description: The number of days until the invoice is due.

name: modify_recurring_service
description:
This tool will update an existing subscription in Stripe. If changing an

existing subscription item, the existing subscription item has to be set
to deleted and the new one has to be added.

subscription_id_to_update.description: The ID of the subscription to update.

proration_handling_rule.description:
Determines how to handle prorations
when the subscription items change. Options: 'create_prorations',
'always_invoice', 'none_implicit', 'none'.

id.description: The ID of the subscription item to modify.

price.description: The ID of the price to switch to.

quantity.description: The quantity of the plan to subscribe to.

list_of_item_updates.description:
A list of subscription items to
update, add, or remove. Each item in the list is a dictionary that
can contain the following keys:

name: process_payment_reversal
description:
This tool will refund a payment intent in Stripe.

It takes three arguments:
- payment_intent (str): The ID of the payment intent to refund.
- amount (int, optional): The amount to refund in cents.
- reason (str, optional): The reason for the refund.

transaction_id_to_refund.description: The ID of the PaymentIntent to refund.

refund_total_in_cents.description: The amount to refund in cents.

name: register_new_client
description: This tool creates a customer in Stripe.

name: respond_to_payment_dispute
description:
Updates a dispute, allowing for the submission of evidence to aid in its resolution.

This function is used to update a specific dispute. When a dispute is received, it is generally best to first contact the customer.
If this does not resolve the issue, this function allows for the submission of evidence to support your position in the dispute.
Evidence provided can be immediately submitted to the bank or staged on the dispute for later submission, based on the `submit` parameter.
Updating any field in the `evidence` hash will submit all fields in that hash for review.

dispute_identifier.description: The ID of the dispute to update.

cancellation_policy_disclosure.description: An explanation of how and when the customer was shown your refund policy prior to purchase.

duplicate_charge_explanation.description: An explanation of the difference between the disputed charge versus the prior charge that appears to be a duplicate.

evidence_payload.description:
Evidence to upload, to respond to a dispute.
Updating any field in the hash will submit all fields in the hash for review.
Expected keys:

submit_evidence_now.description: Whether to immediately submit evidence to the bank. If false, evidence is staged on the dispute.

name: retrieve_client_list
description:
This function fetches a list of Customers from Stripe. It processes an optional `limit`

to control the number of customers retrieved and an optional `email` to filter
customers by their email address in a case-sensitive manner.

max_results_to_return.description: A limit on the number of objects to be returned. Limit can range between 1 and 100.

filter_by_client_email.description: A case-sensitive filter on the list based on the customer's email field. The value must be a string.

name: retrieve_recurring_services
description:
This tool will list all subscriptions in Stripe.

This function lists all subscriptions in Stripe. It allows for filtering the
subscriptions based on customer ID, price ID, status, and limiting the
number of results returned.

subscriber_client_id.description: The ID of the customer to list subscriptions for.

plan_price_filter.description: The ID of the price to list subscriptions for.

filter_by_subscription_state.description:
The status of the subscriptions to retrieve. Possible
values: 'active', 'past_due', 'unpaid', 'canceled', 'incomplete',
'incomplete_expired', 'trialing', 'all'.

max_records_to_show.description:
A limit on the number of objects to be returned.
Limit can range between 1 and 100.

name: terminate_customer_subscription
description:
Cancels a subscription in Stripe.

This function cancels a subscription in Stripe. It requires the ID of the
subscription to be canceled, which is passed as an argument.

subscription_id_to_cancel.description: The ID of the subscription to cancel.
